markdown.markdown:
### University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) B.S. Computational and Systems Biology (September 2021 - June 2025) ## Research ### Zhou Lab (March 2024 - June 2025) I joined the Zhou Lab in March of 2024 under the guidance of Dr. Jasmine Zhou where I developed and applied machine learning models to analyze patient cell-free methylation and mass spectrometry data, aiming to discover new clinical biomarkers and diagnostic tools for liver disease detection. This involved evaluating non-invasive diagnostic methods on 200 Hepatitis B (HBV) patients, utilizing regression and classification models to analyze patient methylation data. Additionally, I explored predictive models for clinical parameters that are essential for liver disease diagnosis and detection. ### Guo Lab (August 2022 - March 2024) I joined the Guo Lab in August 2022 and initiated a secondary analysis on the biomarker and imaging data of over 5000 patients in the Alzheimer’s Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) database under the guidance of Dr. Zhefeng Guo. In parallel with my computational project, I also conducted wet-lab experiments to investigate the relationship of cerebral spinal fluid on Amyloid Beta protein aggregation. Additionally, I led a sequencing team studying mutational effects on protein aggregation with deep mutagenesis & sequencing. Laboratory Skills Acquired
  • Liquid Chromatography
  • Electron Paramagnetic Resonance (EPR)
  • Chemical and Electro Competent Cell Transformation
  • DNA and Protein Electrophoresis
  • PCR
  • Deep Mutagenesis
  • Oxford Nanopore Sequencing
  • Protein Purification
  • Mass Spectrometry
## Teaching ### Swimming During summers, I spend my free time teaching individuals of all ages how to swim. I began my coaching journey as an Assistant Coach at Canyons Aquatics Club designing and leading daily workouts and mentoring swimmers to foster their swimming skills and mindset. Since then, I have continued to teach during my time off and have taught over 50 students ranging from ages 3 to 60, focsuing on individualized instructiona and skill development.

## Education ### University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) B.S. Computational and Systems Biology (September 2021 - June 2025) ## Research ### Zhou Lab (March 2024 - June 2025) I joined the Zhou Lab in March of 2024 under the guidance of Dr. Jasmine Zhou where I developed and applied machine learning models to analyze patient cell-free methylation and mass spectrometry data, aiming to discover new clinical biomarkers and diagnostic tools for liver disease detection. This involved evaluating non-invasive diagnostic methods on 200 Hepatitis B (HBV) patients, utilizing regression and classification models to analyze patient methylation data. Additionally, I explored predictive models for clinical parameters that are essential for liver disease diagnosis and detection. ### Guo Lab (August 2022 - March 2024) I joined the Guo Lab in August 2022 and initiated a secondary analysis on the biomarker and imaging data of over 5000 patients in the Alzheimer’s Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) database under the guidance of Dr. Zhefeng Guo. In parallel with my computational project, I also conducted wet-lab experiments to investigate the relationship of cerebral spinal fluid on Amyloid Beta protein aggregation. Additionally, I led a sequencing team studying mutational effects on protein aggregation with deep mutagenesis & sequencing. Laboratory Skills Acquired
  • Liquid Chromatography
  • Electron Paramagnetic Resonance (EPR)
  • Chemical and Electro Competent Cell Transformation
  • DNA and Protein Electrophoresis
  • PCR
  • Deep Mutagenesis
  • Oxford Nanopore Sequencing
  • Protein Purification
  • Mass Spectrometry
## Teaching ### Swimming During summers, I spend my free time teaching individuals of all ages how to swim. I began my coaching journey as an Assistant Coach at Canyons Aquatics Club designing and leading daily workouts and mentoring swimmers to foster their swimming skills and mindset. Since then, I have continued to teach during my time off and have taught over 50 students ranging from ages 3 to 60, focsuing on individualized instructiona and skill development.
